ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: A Friendly Chat
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Talk to your children about something that they are interested in! 😃

⚽ An easy way to start talking to your children is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about local stories, traditions, sports, favourite books, movies, friends, music, famous people or school-related topics.
;
👂 You may not find everything your children share to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn. 

Paying attention to what matters to your children can make a big difference in your relationship and their happiness.

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Reflect on the Positive
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Spread Positivity! 🌈

💡 Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today. 

☀️ Take turns sharing one positive or fun thing that happened. This could be something small or big, like feeling good because you cleaned the house, took a pause to take some deep breaths, learnt a new dance move, or spent time with your family and friends.

⏰ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: What’s New?
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Learning is fun! 🎓

❓ Ask your children to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together. 
For example, keeping a ball in the air with your foot, learning dance steps, cooking a simple meal together, practising local language phrases, sharing stories from your culture, playing local games and sports, or learning about all the countries in your region.
;
🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your children or yourself for your ability in the skill.

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Check-in Chat
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ⭐
Ask each other questions like: “What made you happy today?” 👂 “What was difficult today?” 👂 “How can I help you?” 👂
For this to help, your children need to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. 💚 
;
Older children tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.
Be kind to yourself if your children do not want to share their problems with you. 💙 Often, children are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won’t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! 🌷

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Express Yourself
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Dancing makes people happy!
🌈 This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
🎵 Together, choose a song, a fun sound, or a clapping pattern to follow and choose a person to start the game by creating one dance move.
👀 The person to their right must copy that dance move and add their own move to it.
✨ Go around the circle, each person adding a new dance move.
;
🔄 The first one who forgets someone's dance moves or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song, sound, or pattern and starts the game again.

🎉 Have fun trying out new dance moves with this game!

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! 🎨
💡 Everyone thinks of 3 facts about themselves. 2 must be true, and 1 must be a lie. 
🔷 Here are some examples: I hate bananas, I enjoy dancing, and my favourite subject in school was maths.
👀 Share your facts with your children and ask them to guess which one is a lie. 
🔄 Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
Did you learn anything new about your children, or did they learn anything new about you? 💛

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Yes, No or Maybe
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Are you tired of hearing your children say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don’t allow one-word answers. 🎈

🔴 Older children are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking. 
💡 When you would like to really know how your children are doing, you can turn your chat into a game. 
⭐ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses like Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
⚽ You can ask about things your children like or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited about? Is there anything worrying you?
🔄 It is important to let your children ask a question as well. Trust is built when your children can see that you are also sharing your life with them and not only trying to learn about their life.

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Get Active
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Exercise is a great way to spend time together, and it is so good for your health. 🌱 Find a sport or exercise activity that both you and your children want to do and try it out together! Be mindful of the safety of the space you are using for exercise. 

⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you. 
⚽Together, try walking, running, dancing, stretching, playing games like hide-and-seek, or any other physical activities you enjoy.
;
🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you run to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward like getting to decide the next activity?
🌈 Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it. 
🔄 If you or your children do not like the first type of exercise you pick, try a new way to exercise.

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Take a Pause With Your Children
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Take a pause with your children. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
⏰ You could take a pause together at any time, or you could try at a specific time like before meals or bedtime.
👂 Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. 
⭐ Take 5 more deep breaths.
;
👀 When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different? 
⏸ Ask your children what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: This Is Who I Am
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your children have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! 🏆
⭐Share with your children 3 things you like about yourself!
3️⃣ Ask your children to tell you 3 things they like about themselves. 
;
For example, I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at styling my hair. I am great at football. ⚽
If any of your children do not feel comfortable sharing these, ask them to write them down. 📝

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Weekly Goal Setting
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
Let’s set some goals ⭐

⏰ It can be helpful to set smaller weekly goals that are easier to reach, especially when life feels uncertain. 
 
💡Ask each of your children for one goal that they would like to achieve this week. 

🔄 Make sure this goal is *specific* and *achievable* to reach in 1 week, like: practising deep breathing for 5 minutes every day, exercising for 10 minutes three times a week, journaling feelings every night, or spending quality time with family or friends daily.
;
💚 You can also share your own weekly goals with your children and support each other so you can both achieve your goals.

🎉 Make sure to praise and celebrate your children for their hard work towards reaching their goals.

🔔 If your children do not reach their goals, that is okay. Discuss with them the steps they still need to take or how they could reach it a different way.

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: One-on-One Time
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
💚 Spending time just with your children and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship. 

👀 When your children are playing alone or occupying themselves, join them and show interest in what they are doing.

👂Ask questions about their activity and listen to them.
;
Let your children lead the activity and follow them to build their confidence and autonomy. 😃

👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your children’s actions.

Be positive, praise your children and enjoy spending this time with them. 😃💚

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Animals
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
🧸 **Active Animals** 
Take turns with your children doing animal actions. You might hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, or flap like a bird. Add your own actions and animals! 
;
💡**All the Animals We Can Think Of** 
Think about groups of animals and talk about them with your children! 
What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers? What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? 🌱 What animals can we think of that lay eggs?

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Active Counting
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
👋 Clap, hop, jump: Play the following game with your children. Make it active!

1️⃣ Clap hands 1 time. 
2️⃣ Clap hands 2 times.
1️⃣ Jump 1 time. 
2️⃣ Jump 2 times.
1️⃣ Hop 1 time.
3️⃣ Hop 3 times.
💡 Can you hop, then jump, then clap? 
🏆 Can you clap twice, jump once, and hop three times?
;
💡 Remembering Instructions
Take turns playing a game where you give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to remember to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!
For example:
Hop twice, turn around.
Jump to the kitchen, pick up a spoon, then run back. ✅

ltp_activity_crisis_data.name: Active Songs
ltp_activity_crisis_data.text:
😃 Young children love physical games but they need reminders about how to play. 💡
🎵 Songs with movements are fun and active and give instructions on how to move!
;
Sing songs to your children in which they have to follow instructions like:
✅ Start and stop ❌
⬇️ Slow down and speed up ⬆️
